moves.3. Bb5+: a developing move by the b.
moves.3... c6 4. Ba4: in order to maintain the pin.
moves.4... Bc5: developing the b and attacking the f2 pawn at the same time.
moves.5. dxc6 Bxf2+: if 6.Kxf2, then 6...Qd4+ , attacking the Bish at a4 and preventing the k from castling.
moves.6. Kf1: wonder why he did this. maybe trying to save the Bish
moves.6... bxc6 7. Qe2: thus attacking both the Bish at f2 and the pawn at e5.
moves.7... Ba6: bet he did not see this.
moves.9. Nf3 Nf6 10. c3: best move for white is Nxe5.
moves.10... Bxc3: threatening Bxd3, winning the q. the move culminates in winning the d3 pawn come move 13.
moves.11... Bxe5 12. Qxe5+ Kf8 13. Ke1: to prevent 13...Qxd3+ (white prevented the + but not the taking of the dpawn)
moves.13... Qxd3: anywhere the k moves, black wins the pawn.
moves.15... Nbd7: a move to not only to gain a tempo but threaten the next move.
moves.16. Qf2 Re8+: White resigned. mate in 5: 16..Re8+ 17.Ne2 Ne4 18.Qf1 Ng3 19.hxg3 Rxe2+ 20.Qxe2 Qxe2++
